columns.text: In this problem, we will need to fill in the missing values from the pro forma income statement and solve for the operating cash flow and the depreciation tax shield.

When given an income statement, we must first identify the given. In this particular statement, we are given the sales as well as the costs and depreciation. From these values, we can solve the earnings before interest and tax.

To solve the earnings before interest and tax (EBIT), we can simply subtract both the depreciation and costs from the sales. We will then have:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{EBIT}&=\$747,300-\$582,600-\$89,300\\[15 pt]
&=\$75,400
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the earnings before interest and tax for this particular project is $\$75,400$

Now that we have the EBIT, we can then solve for the tax and the net income. 

To solve for the tax, simply multiply the rate to the EBIT. This will give us:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Tax}&=\$75,400\times 0.22\\[15 pt]
&=\$16,588
\end{aligned}$$

The tax for this particular investment is $\$16,588$

To finally solve for the net income, simply subtract the tax from the EBIT.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net income}&=\$75,400-\$16,588\\[15 pt]
&=\$58,812
\end{aligned}$$

The net income for this project is $\$58,812$

The income statement will now look like this:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sales}&=\$747,300\\
\text{Costs}&=\$582,600\\
\text{Depreciation}&=\$89,300\\
\text{EBIT}&=\$75,400\\
\text{Tax} (22\%)&=\$16,588\\
\text{Net income}&=\$58,812
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{OCF}&=\$75,400+\$89,300-\$16,588\\[15 pt]
&=\$148,112
\end{aligned}$$

The operating cash flow of this investment is $\$148,112$

The depreciation tax shield refers to the tax saved from the depreciation of the assets in a project. Since some assets have limited lifetime, the tax for the income is adjusted to take into account the depreciation. In order to solve this, we can simply the tax rate by the depreciation.

This will give us a depreciation tax shield of:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation tax shield}&=\$89,300 \times 0.22\\[15 pt]
&=\$19,646
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the tax shield is $\$19,646$. Since the depreciation tax shield is higher than the tax, this means that the asset being assessed for depreciation is relatively new therefore the tax is higher.
